definition: title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: If you ignore the warning and keep on flaming , you will be banned without notice.
sentences.chinese: 如果无视警告继续攻击对方，则不经通知直接封号。

sentences.english: "Wanfo Lake" tourism development should be said that those who gave it "character.
sentences.chinese: “万佛湖”应该说是旅游开发者给它的美丽封号。

sentences.english: I'm 23 years old and got banned from a virtual farming game for threatening children.
sentences.chinese: 我23岁，因为威胁儿童被虚拟农场游戏封号。

sentences.english: Are seal numbers checked against the manifest at time of unlading ?
sentences.chinese: 货时根据集装箱明细单检查封号？

sentences.english: If I could have one more medal, I would. But I just can't.
sentences.chinese: 那就这么多勋章，西域分王这个封号留着。

sentences.english: She has confirmed that she will accept the honour of a peerage.
sentences.chinese: 她已经证实自己将接受贵族封号。

definition: to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to ban (narcotics, a movie etc)/to block (a road etc)/(Internet) to block (a user)
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
to win the championship/(of an emperor) to bestow the title of king on a subject
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to confer a posthumous title
to lift a ban
the imperial family/royal kin
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to deprive/to strip of
emperor
title/appellation/form of address
succession/inheritance/hereditary
